definition: lit. punish one, warn one hundred (idiom)/fig. to make an example of sb
to punish/to reprimand/to warn
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to warn/to admonish
surname Bai
hundred/numerous/all kinds of

sentences.english: Those responsible for the disturbance in the prison were made an example of/made examples of by the governor.
sentences.chinese: 为惩一儆百，监狱长惩罚了在监狱制造骚乱的人。

definition: lit. kill one to warn a hundred (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
in order to warn against following bad examples (idiom)/as a warning to others
lit. to punish those before to prevent those after (idiom); to criticize former mistakes firmly to prevent them happening again
variant of 殺一儆百|杀一儆百[sha1 yi1 jing3 bai3]
to follow a bad example
to punish (someone)/to take disciplinary action against (someone)
to disregard the law
to punish/to administer justice
to punish
to punish severely
to keep doing evil without a sense of repentance (idiom)
to wipe out dissenters/to exterminate those who disagree
lit. killing the chicken to scare the monkey (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
lit. to kill a chicken in front of a monkey; fig. to make an example of sb (by punishment) to frighten others
to warn/to admonish
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty
